_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Facility Policy:  The Owners, management and employees of Mid-West Fertilizer, Inc. A? Oswego are committed to the prevention of any accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia.  If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the local fire department and low enforcement personnel to mitigate any release to residents and the environment of our community.

Facility information:  The primary activity at the facility is the storage and sales of fertilizer to farm producers in our area.
a.    Anhydrous ammonia is received, stored and distributed for direct application as a crop production            nutrient.

b.    The maximum quantity stored would be 106,000 pounds.

Worst-Case Release Scenario and Alternative Release Scenario:

a.    The worst-case release scenario would be the total release of the anhydrous ammonia from our major storage tank. The distance to the endpoint is 1.3 miles.

b.    The alternative release scenario is a release from a break in a transfer hose.  The distance to the endpoint is 0.7 miles.


Accidental Release Prevention Program:  The facility has implemented the provisions of A?Safety Requirements for the Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia, K-61-1A? published by the American National Standards institute, Inc.  Anything out of the ordinary is reported to our 24 hour telephone number and the police take necessary actions.  The Oswego Fire Department conducts an annual fire inspection of the facility.

Five-Year Accident History:  There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five years that have caused any deaths, injuries, or significant property damage at this facility, nor to our knowledge, have resulted in offsite death, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage.

Emergency Response Program:  Our facility has coordinated with the local responders and we do not plan to have our employees respond to a major release.

a.    Additional Facility Emergency co

ntact:

For further information contact Mr. Chad Mustain, Mid-West Fertilizer, Inc. A? Oswego, 12062 US Hwy 59, Oswego, KS 67356, (620) 795-2209.
